sentences.english: Yoda, acting as general, oversaw the battle from the forward command center.
sentences.chinese: 尤達擔任統帥，在前線指揮中心督戰。

sentences.english: Ultimately, though, his duty was to his commander in chief.
sentences.chinese: 當然最後還是要落實到他作爲統帥的責任。

sentences.english: We of the Ashtar Galactic Command thank you for your attention.
sentences.chinese: 我們阿西塔銀河系的統帥們，感謝你們的注意。

sentences.english: Generously to show him as commander in chief for the fearless courage and great spirit hung.
sentences.chinese: 慨然表現出他作爲統帥的無畏膽識與雄大氣魄。

sentences.english: For the first time Peter begain to out-general his adversary
sentences.chinese: 彼得第一次在統帥力上超越了他的對手。

sentences.english: Also, generals ran their armies this way.
sentences.chinese: 將領也是這樣統帥軍隊的。

sentences.english: An officer must know how to handle his soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 軍官應該知道怎麼樣統帥他的士兵。

sentences.english: The President is Commander-in-Chief of the army, but Congress appropriates money for a standing army.
sentences.chinese: 總統是軍隊的統帥，但軍費是由國會撥出的。

sentences.english: Even military leaders two decades ago chose to share power with a clique.
sentences.chinese: 即便是二十年前的軍隊統帥也將權力分散到小團體。

sentences.english: But the president's role as commander in chief cut two ways.
sentences.chinese: 但是，總統的角色與統帥的職責無法相安無事。

sentences.english: Now, for the first time, Peter began to out-general his adversary.
sentences.chinese: 現在，彼得第一次在統帥能力上超越了他的對手。

sentences.english: Carthaginian general, one of the great military leaders of antiquity.
sentences.chinese: 迦太基人，古代最偉大的軍事統帥之一。

sentences.english: Sir, there's a call on your line from supreme headquarters, General Smith.
sentences.chinese: 長官，您的熱線上有最高統帥部史密斯將軍的電話。

sentences.english: And as long as I’m Commander-in-Chief, it’s a promise we’ll keep. Thank you.
sentences.chinese: 只要我擔任統帥，我將繼續恪守承諾。

sentences.english: But also those who received the highest title of nobility is more prominent commander of military merit.
sentences.chinese: 而且能獲此最高爵位者多是軍功顯赫的統帥。

definition: Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
an execution/to put sb to death
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
